description: Etobicoke is a relaxed area along the Humber River. It's saturated with green spaces and conservatories, making it a premier destination for outdoor sports, hiking, and nature walks. Its abundance of parkland and lakes makes it a typical spot for fishing, picnicking, and camping out, especially in warmer months. The peaceful area is also enjoyed by families, who appreciate its boardwalks and sports facilities. Locals enjoy the variety of golfing and country club opportunities, which also provide lessons for golfers of any skill level.

reviews.title: ok as a treat
text: DOORS DIDNT OPEN UNTIL 30 MINUTES BEFORE MOVIE TIME WHICH LED TO US NOT GETTING OUR FOOD DELIVERED UNTIL AFTER THE START OF THE MOVIE. ( check in, get to seats, order ).  RESULT:  EATING IN THE DARK.  Distracted from the movie.

Food service was good.  Food was ok.   I had pulled pork and my partner had a burger. With fries. Movie was good but I found pricing a bit high for the comfort experience at about $50. ( 2 people for the movie and cinema) . 2 Meals with 2 beers was about $55 so about the same as at a standard restaurant.  I'm ok with that.
At total over $100 it is not something I can justify doing often.

reviews.title: servers delivering food during the movie
text: We love VIP at queensway but the last 2 movies we have seen have been interrupted by servers delivering  orders after movie has started.the last time it was during 1st two minutes of movie and the server was loud and stood in my view .but today it was 32 minutes into the black panther movie and again server stood in front of me to serve the people next to me..they apologisged but that did not help e see that part of the movie and actually took away from my immersion in the movie.I complained to customer service,manager after and he said its part of the vip to be served ,he did not understand or care that the servers were in my way..it says orders will not be taken after movie starts.

reviews.title: Worst customer service
text: Any of the Cineplex theatres!!! NOT ONE will answer their phones! What is the point of having the number listed if they will bother to answer them! Websites do not have all the answers and emails are never returned in a prompt fashion!

reviews.title: FIRST MOVIE IN A LONGGGG TIME!!!!!!
text: First movie back after all the lengthy COVID shutdowns....so we decided to GO BIG and see SUICIDE SQUAD (MUCH better than the first one thankfully!!!!) at the VIP theatre.
Contact tracing at door masks required, all inside distancing enforced and as it was an early afternoon film there were very few of us in VIP.
Ordered a beer each, some truffle fries (ok.....but get cold quickly) and remarkably GOOD warm and tasty fried chicken tacos (great recommendation by our server !!!).
The last time we were there the NACHOS were terrible so this was a welcomed improvement.

reviews.title: Great to be back at the theatree
text: After 14 months it was great to get back to our retired routine and watch a movie. The staff as very efficient, making sure that we were safe. The disappointing part was our usual order of poutine was missed because they had no cheese curds.

reviews.title: Gorgeous Bar area
text: Very impressed by the beauty of the bar, the private bathrooms, the artwork and lounge /eating area outside of each vip theatre. Loved it. Must be 19 an over. Large tequila cocktail bowls and great bistro /pub food can be ordered in theatre. Arrive early to order, as you will not be able to order once the movie starts to avoid interruption. Currently $69 on Wednesday for 2 people including food. Great deal.

reviews.title: Always fun
text: Out of all the theaters close by (there's 4), we prefer to go to the Cineplex on Queensway. It always clean. The staff are friendly and welcoming. My kids absolutely love going here.

reviews.title: Star Wars : the rise of skywalker
text: The chair is comfortable, movie with food , drink , dessert together, was enjoying the show.
See you next time .

reviews.title: Ir was a nice step up in seating comfort and leg room.
text: Since we only go out to a movie theater two three times a year, this was definitely a nice treat.  The price differential between the VIP and standard tickets are not that significant. although we did not use the VIP food option of having popcorn delivered to you seats, it was a very nice option.

reviews.title: Auditorium #9, 10AM regular screening, sat in front of D-Box row
text: We chose to watch Avengers: Endgame in its second weekend at Cineplex Queensway.  I checked out showtimes days earlier and, since reserved seating was available for all screenings, it was a no-brainer to buy tickets online. For this much-anticipated movie, arriving early to buy tickets at the self-serve kiosk or box office would not do as the best seats would be mostly gone.

When I finally went online Fri afternoon to buy tickets for the 10AM Sat regular screening, most mid- to back-row seats were already taken and the next best adjoining seats I could reserve were seats I19 to I21 (3rd row from the back).  Cineplex no longer requires printed tickets, just show them on your phone (we saved pdf files so no data required). General admission costs $14.99.

This Cineplex location has a huge parking lot and there were plenty of empty spots when we arrived Sat morning. Past the entrance, auditorium #9 is on the left side of the building, first door on the right after the ticket checker. As per seating map, this auditorium seats 279, and has 13 rows total: rows AA-BB nearest the screen, wide aisle then rows A-K.
TimePlay was over when we entered the auditorium at 9:59AM. Movie trailers were shown at 10:10AM. Lights off at 10:19AM and the feature film immediately followed.

Regular screening was satisfactory. Video and audio were both clear. Seating was comfortable enough. We sat in front of D-Box row and we could feel strong vibrations during on-screen action scenes! It was totally unexpected but cool. My only complaint was the sticky floor, obviously no wet mopping done the night before as we were here for the first screening of the day.

This was our family’s first time watching a movie here as we usually go to Cineplex Mississauga. Another thing I like about Cineplex Queensway is that the washrooms are located beside the auditoriums so there is no need to show ticket when going back if you cannot avoid a mid-movie bathroom break.

reviews.title: Adequate movie-going
text: Projector has broken down, but staff always offers free passes with no expiry. Comparable to other VIP cinemas in the area.

reviews.title: Once you go VIP you'll never go back!!!
text: Okay so yes it is pricey but soooo well worth it! You pick your spots in advance and the best part is no children crying and running around or young teens. Its 19 plus so that makes it all the more worth it. Service is first class in the bar/lounge area where you can have a few drinks and snacks or a meal while waiting for your movie. Large tvs to watch your favorite sports too. There is in seat service in the movie theater before the movie. (They will tell you how much time you have left for the service) The atmosphere alone is worth the money for a wonderful night out. The chairs are extremely comfy and the arm rest in the middle can be moved for comfort. The side tables can be swung in and out so that you can snack and eat more comfortably. Washrooms are very clean and well kept. I recommend this 100x over! I do not think I would ever go back to choosing regular seats. This is luxury and comfort for anyone looking for a reasonable night out! Excellent!

reviews.title: Horrible experience VIP is laughable
text: The theatre itself is nice leather seats nice dining area but THAT was it.  We arrived an hour before our movie, and  ordered drinks it took 30 minutes after asking 3 times where the beer was. We ordered 2 burgers, 2 wraps and a plate of nachos, the burgers showed up but nothing else.  We kept asking where the rest of the food was, by the time we went in for the movie it still had not arrived, this is  after talking to the waitress the manager  several times and there were aprox 10 people in the eating area only so it wasn't busy.  while we started to watch the movie finally some of the food arrived except for 1 wrap seriously come on - we asked again where it was and the response was oh there was another wrap - rediculous.  In the end we never did get the last wrap and the food delivered to us in the theatre was stone cold. they finally told us that we didn't have to pay for the food and the drinks and gave us free movie passes, which I do appreciate but in the end I will never go back to this location and to be honest paying $50 to see a movie in a bigger seat is really not worth  it.  I would have much more enjoyed just going to the regular theatre getting a popcorn and a coke. And that is what I will do from now on at different location to be sure

reviews.title: Hard theater to beat - has all the amenities - and great seat and atmosphere
text: It has all of the modern amenities, several places to eat - their own place, Tim Horton's, a popcorn place, and even a place for dinner. There is a play area for arcade-like games for winning tickets for prizes, and a boatload of other stuff to keep the kids occupied. The theaters have nice comfortable seats, and the lightning and look of the theaters is great. I thought the sound was great, and the number of theaters adequate. The only quibble is pricing is high on foodstuffs, but this seems to be a theme with all theaters, no just this one.

reviews.title: First Class Customer service
text: I'm a movie fanatic but after going to the VIP cineplex, to be honest, i can't get enough of the super comfortable couches and menu etc i could watch a movie for 3 hrs or more, i super recommend you come here after a stressful day, you won't regret it.

reviews.title: Wow! Awesome
text: We watched the new Captain America movie last night. It was a different experience as we've never tried the D-Box seats. For $20.99, your seat is reserved, which is great because we were late. The seats are wider and Red (easier to see in the dark) the only thing I didn't like was they seemed a bit higher and being 5'2" my feet were swinging a bit too much for my liking. So the seats kind of rumble when there is anything loud on the screen and if you aren't expecting it the first explosion will scare you to death! Even my husband was rocked by the seat! You can adjust the amount of movement in your seat because it can be very distracting not to mention dizzying! Enjoyed the balance of movie with my seat turned off. There are only a few rows of the D-Box seats in the theatre. You also get a ton of leg room in addition to larger seats. Kind of worth it.

reviews.title: Amazing night at the movies!
text: This is by far the best Cineplex of them all in Toronto and offers a VIP theatre with many options. The bar and food is great, amazing service.

reviews.title: Not bad
text: This is a decent theatre to come to. It is comparable to other cinemas. Worth the visit to watch a film.

reviews.title: VIP The Way to Go!!!
text: LOVE LOVE the VIP theatre. It's the only way to see a movie. It's for 18+ only. Beer/wine/drinks, treats and food brought to you in your comfortable sofa-style chair. Amazing.

reviews.title: Missed our movie
text: We paid in advance ($50) for two VIP tickets.  We arrived at the theater parking lot 40 minutes before our movie was to begin.  Unfortunately there is nowhere near enough parking.  We circled the parking lot for 40 minutes at which point my wife got out of the car, and went in to get us a refund.  The girl who refunded our tickets was friendly and explained that this happens all the time because they just don't have enough parking spaces now that they have the VIP theaters built.

reviews.title: The Full Experience
text: This is the VIP theatre I go to most often. They have valet parking, the restaurant & bar area is really nice, the order-up food to my seat is on point, as are the drinks. The only thing I don't like is that if I want some regular food I have to go outside, and then back in on the regular Cineplex. This is if I would want something like Poptopia, for example. But everything else is so good that that glitch is a minor one.

reviews.title: IMAX and VIP is exceptional
text: This location is conveniently placed along the Queensway with easy access to shopping and restaurants in the area.  Lots of free parking and the facility itself is kept clean and the staff are quite attentive.
Many food and drink options inside and the VIP features chair side service up until time of a movie start.

All screens are high quality and the sound is great as well.  Daytime matinees can be slow, so often it’s like getting a semi private screening.    Their website is kept current and it’s always best to review times, etc in advance.

reviews.title: Beautiful theatre
text: This place is so clean, organized, multiple food selection including something I just noticed today the VIP experience. Restaurant quality food and beverages while you watch a movie. Very cool. Also great selection of movies, today we say Dunkirk.

reviews.title: Great VIP Theater
text: My boyfriend and I went to see a movie at this theater - we have a VIP theater in Edmonton, and anytime we're in an area that has one we always go see something. The food was great, service was fast and the theater was clean. The bathrooms here aren't set up like one room with a bunch of stalls, all the bathrooms are individual and were spotless, which I thought was great.

reviews.title: Awesome D-box seats
text: Went 2x during our 2 wks visit in town. Regular seats is average, nothing great.  Inside appearance a bit dirty compare our usual theater but also compare with VIP. Went the 2nd time because we wanted to try the D-box. It's something new for us and it didn't disappoint us. My kids enjoyed it. Have to pick a movie with lots of action to enjoy the d-box seats + take advantage of 1/2 price on Tuesday.

reviews.title: Great March-break deals
text: $2.99 movie tickets during march break was an excellent outing for the kids. Arcade games for all ages, lots of prizes (mostly candy)

Concession very expensive $7 popcorn $4.50 drinks & the line up at concession is chaotic. My son wasn't serviced because adults would keep going in front of him & the teens behind the counter don't pay attention/intervene.

reviews.title: Love the VIP Theatres
text: We've been going to this theatre since it opened.  It has always been good but now there is the VIP Theatres and the movie experience is awesome.  The service is great and the VIP chairs are very comfortable

reviews.title: Almost perfect
text: The movie experience here is great. Eighteen screens of movies, a variety of concession options, and a decent arcade area. Service is quite good. The staff are generally helpful and friendly.
The issues/helpful hints...
1. Costco offers a nice deal for 2 movies, 2 drinks, and popcorn at this theatre.
2. They have a rewards program called "SCENE" that allows you to accumulate points toward free movies. The SCENE card is accepted here of course, as well as a few other well-known retailers.
3. Parking on weekends can be a major frustration. If it is a busy movie weekend, don't expect to be able to park easily/quickly.
4. The line to buy tickets can be long. Be sure to account for this when coming here. If available, use the self-serve kiosks.
A great experience overall!

reviews.title: GREAT AND BAD
text: My husband and I went to see Rogue One. We had never used the VIP option, but we're really glad we did for this movie. The lounge was well stocked with spirits and knowledgeable bartenders. The seats in the theatre were comfy and roomy. The food and mixed drinks were very delicious.

Our only complaint is that they forgot to bring us our burgers. We ordered them 20 minutes before the movie. 20 minutes into the movie my husband spoke to an attendant about our burgers and was told they were still bringing out food. 1 hour later, still nothing. He got up twice to ask about our food and they finally brought it out in a scene where you don't want someone standing in front of you. And the girl fumbling with our meals almost dropped our food on us since she couldn't see where she was placing the plates. The delicious food made up for this though. But by that time, we weren't all that hungry anymore.
Still a decent experience with NO crying babies, no chatting preteens, and mixed drinks whenever you want.

reviews.title: Poor quality seating in 3D theatre
text: Wonderful complex of theatres and eating areas. Had waited to see Ben-Hur in 3 D for some time. Theatre was almost empty. The seating is very inferior compared to other theatres we've visited. Seats didnt recline very easily and there were no leg rests or tables to set food on. Upgrades are needed.

reviews.title: Corporate event / Seminar
text: This is a very large theatre with an equally large parking lot. I've seen movies here a few times over the years. It is conveniently located near Gardiner Expressway and Islington. There are a few restaurants across the parking lot for meals before/after the movie.

They have self-service ticket kiosks, several food vendors, a full arcade, etc. They have all the theatre types like 3D, VIP, Dolby ATMOS, Ultra AVX and D-BOX. The theatres and washrooms are clean. There is a Ti mePlay WiFi to allow for contests before a movie begins.
Since the movie ticket checking isn't done after you buy concessions, you could always come to the arcade and concessions without seeing a movie.
They can also rent out a theatre for corporate events or seminars during the daytime. Cineplex can provide a separate WiFi connection for the event.

reviews.title: Bohemian Rhapsody movie
text: Comfortable seats the VIP is well worth it
Clean
Good apps
Great spot for get together before and after your movie 🎥

reviews.title: FUN
text: its great and really neat and tidy not to far wawy the theatres and arcde restraunts fast food its okay not the best

reviews.title: Good choice for movie viewing
text: Nice theatre , clean, good sized rooms.  If you go on Tuesday for the matinee there is lots of room and the price is right.

reviews.title: Movie night
text: Great seating
Fun night you can't say anything wrong a out this location.
Good selection of food choices and snacks. Popcorn was fresh

reviews.title: Love
text: We love going to the movies, and always enjoy ourselves. This theatre is always clean and the staff are friendly. I just wish it wasn't sooooo expensive so we could go more often.

reviews.title: First class movie going
text: Even an average movie is an above average experience at the Cineplex Cinemas Queensway & VIP.
Highly comfortable and over-sized seats with individual serving tables allow for attendant servers to bring libations, snacks, and some nice food choices right to your seat.

For very little extra, VIP movie going is a top-notch option. We particularly like the Cineplex Cinemas Queensway & VIP because it is the only VIP location in Toronto, including the three downtown, that can be reached in less than 10 minutes from downtown, thanks to the QEW highway. Parking is also free, as opposed to downtown locations, and they offer VIP parking to and from the theater entrance for $6. For leisure loving movie goers, the Cineplex Cinemas Queensway & VIP is a great way to go.

reviews.title: Terrible Customer Service
text: Terrible Customer Service At Cineplex Queensway VIP

It’s May 19, 2016 at about 12:30am and I just finished watching a movie at this theatre with my husband and a couple of friends. It was a rare night out as for us as we all had small children, and arranging to have babysitters for late night outs can be difficult.
We spent over $150 in the theatre for VIP tickets, food, and drinks. However the whole movie, my husband was waiting for his drink and it never came.

After the movie we went to the concession and told a worker that the drink (which is priced at $10.50) was never delivered. The worker left us for about 5 minutes and another worker came back to tell us that they cannot give us a refund as they are closed but they can give us a $25 voucher which is more than our $10.50 drink.

Our friend asked if they could give us 2 vouchers instead so that we can at least be able to enjoy as a couple. But the worker said that he can’t make that decision as he is just the mouthpiece and not the manager. So I asked for the manager and my friend asked him to see what he can do.

He left us again for another 5 minutes and returned by himself saying that they were able to open their cash box and refund us the $10.50. He handed the $10.50 to my husband and said that they hope for us to return to the theatre. To which my husband replied, “Not likely.”

We were baffled at the low level of customer service, which is supposed to be a VIP experience. Not only did they take back the $25 voucher that they offered at first and only refund us the price of the drink, but they never apologized for the inconvenience for not delivering the drink, they didn’t refund the tax we paid for the drink, and the manager never bothered to show up to talk to us. Extremely disappointing. Our friends and I could not help but continue to talk about how frustrated we felt about the terrible service.

reviews.title: Great Service disgusting surroundings
text: Excellent service by the staff. After to my horror I saw something running around, I turned to look at it and it was running up the stairs, it was definitely a mouse or a rat.  I was in auditorium 17.

reviews.title: Movie night!
text: Great time visiting here with some friends to watch movies we always come here to watch the marvel movies and end up having a great time
